Race.SummaryText:
FIFTH WARD PROPOSITION
(TAX RENEWAL)

SUMMARY:  10 YEAR, 1 MILL PROPERTY TAX RENEWAL FOR MAINTAINING PUBLIC CEMETERIES IN THE WARD.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Evangeline, State of Louisiana, levy a one (1) mill tax (the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one entire year being $15,077) on all the property subject to taxation with the Fifth Ward of Evangeline Parish, Louisiana (the "Ward") for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018, for the purpose of maintaining public cemeteries in the Ward?

Race.SpecificTitle: Wd.One Wardwide Sch. Dist -- $28,500,000 Bond - SB - 40 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
WARD ONE WARDWIDE SCHOOL DISTRICT  PROPOSITION
(BOND)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY TO ISSUE NOT EXCEEDING $28,500,000 OF 40 YEAR GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS WITH THE PROCEEDS OF THE BONDS TO BE USED FOR THE PURPOSE OF IMPROVING BUILDING SITES AND PLAYGROUNDS, INCLUDING CONSTRUCTION OF NECESSARY SIDEWALKS AND STREETS ADJACENT THERETO; PURCHASING, ERECTING AND/OR IMPROVING SCHOOL BUILDINGS AND OTHER SCHOOL RELATED FACILITIES WITHIN AND FOR THE DISTRICT, AND ACQUIRING THE NECESSARY EQUIPMENT AND FURNISHINGS THEREFOR, TITLE TO WHICH SHALL BE IN THE PUBLIC.
Race.FullText: Shall Ward One Wardwide School District of the Parish of Evangeline, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Twenty-Eight Million Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($28,500,000), to be issued in series from time to time, to run not exceeding forty (40) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding eight per centum (8%) per annum, for the purpose of improving building sites and playgrounds, including construction of necessary sidewalks and streets adjacent thereto; purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District, and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District, and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto?
